entry.title: How to leverage the SAP AI Core Service to use some powerful AI tools like Claude Code, Chat Wise
entry.content:
Our company is rolling out GitHub Copilot on a large scale. However, in real-world scenarios, a single coding assistant is rarely enough. Different agents shine in different use cases.

For example, in my own experience, Claude Code is far more powerful than GitHub Copilot when it comes to actual coding. It enables true Vibe Coding in a way Copilot simply can’t.

That said, compliance is always a priority at work. Even if you’ve purchased personal subscriptions, you can’t just use external models freely. This article will walk you through how to leverage company-provided AI models and integrate them into external AI tools.

 

Prerequisites

First, you’ll need to request an AI Core client ID and secret. One way is via the official request process, but you can also subscribe and deploy it yourself on BTP.

Apply url:

https://wiki.one.int.sap/wiki/display/IECOE/GAI02.08+Service+Now+User+Guideline#GAI02.08ServiceNowUserGuideline-HowtoRequestAPIaccessforSAPGenAIPlatform%28Playground%29 (see Appendix).

Once approved, you’ll receive credentials like this:

{
  "AICORE_AUTH_URL": "https://sapit-core-playground-vole.authentication.eu10.hana.ondemand.com",
  "AICORE_CLIENT_ID": "id",
  "AICORE_CLIENT_SECRET": "secret",
  "AICORE_RESOURCE_GROUP": "1768f3f7-6c5b-45de-aeb8-xxxxxxx",
  "AICORE_BASE_URL": "https://api.ai.prod.eu-central-1.aws.ml.hana.ondemand.com/v2"
}

Our company supports nearly all mainstream models (GPT, Gemini, Sonet, etc.). The challenge is that SAP applies its own unique protocol layer, which makes these endpoints unusable directly with external tools.

To solve this, we need a proxy service that unwraps the SAP protocol and re-exposes it in OpenAI or Anthropic-compatible formats.

Thanks to Arch (EAS) and Xeric Wei, we already have such a proxy available: genaiproxy. It currently supports OpenAI and Anthropic. You can use it as is or fork it to extend for other protocols.

Setup

  • Python version: 3.13.6

  • Create config.json and key.json under config/ (see samples in repo).

  • Run proxy_service_v2.py to start the proxy.

By default, it runs at: http://127.0.0.1:9988

 

Example: Chatwise

Configure Chatwise with the following:

  • Anthropic

    • Base URL: http://127.0.0.1:9988/anthropic

    • API Key: your configured key (e.g. sk-kris)

  • OpenAI

    • Base URL: http://127.0.0.1:9988/openai/v1

    • API Key: your configured key

⚠️Note: SAP Core AI doesn’t yet support the response API format. GPT-5 still works, but only through a workaround.

Also, since SAP truncates model suffixes, you might want to hardcode the model name in your tool configuration.

Once set up, Chatwise works seamlessly — and the speed is excellent.

 

Example: Claude Code

Claude Code is widely regarded as one of the strongest agents for coding. Unlike GUI-based tools, it’s CLI-native, so it doesn’t require setting up an MCP server. It can do even more.

Installation is simple: Claude Code Docs.

To connect it with the proxy, configure your environment variables:

export ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL=http://127.0.0.1:9988/anthropic
export ANTHROPIC_AUTH_TOKEN=sk-kris

That’s it. Enjoy the full power of Claude Code with your company’s AI Core.

 

Other tools like Cline work in a similar way.

With this setup, you can stay compliant, use company-provided AI Core services, and still enjoy the full ecosystem of modern AI coding agents.

entry.title: Dunning per Mail/Printing only if there is no Mail-Adress
entry.content:
Hello,

we want to dunn our customers and send the dunning per mail. Only if there is no mail-address in the BP master data, we want the dunning note to be printed. How do we have to define the output control settings?

I already checked the Output-Parameter information and it works, that dunning notes are being sent per mail. But we want the system to send it only if there is a mail adress in the BP master data. Otherwise the dunning note should be printed.

If i choose the settings in the determination step channel like this:

Output TypeRoleAccount TypeDefault Email AddressChannelExclusive Indicator
=DUNN_NOTICE  is not initialEMAILX
=DUNN_NOTICE   PRINT 

SAP creates only an E-Mail when there is a mail address in the BP master Data, which is correct. But if there is no mail address, no mail AND no print is created.

When i choose the settings like this:

Output TypeRoleAccount TypeDefault Email AddressChannelExclusive Indicator
=DUNN_NOTICE  is not initialEMAIL-
=DUNN_NOTICE   PRINT 

SAP prints ONLY when there is no mail address (which is good). But when there is a mail address, SAP prints AND sends a mail.

Can you tell me where i made a mistake? Is the column "Default E-Mail Address" the correct one? Or do i handle the column "Exclusive Indicator" wrongly?

entry.title: Re: SAP S4Hana Cloud 拣配生产订单组件中，拣配行项目中EWM相关字段不可编辑，如何才能编辑？
entry.content:
Hi @jayden_glamour 

感谢您的提问。

更多详情请参阅《SAP扩展仓库管理基础集成》及《EWM与制造模块集成》。

简而言之，您无法编辑拣货生产订单组件应用程序——公共云环境中不允许此操作。系统会通过EWM中的生产供应区分配、仓库流程类型确定及存储位映射主数据设置自动确定这些组件。

若需修改这些值，请在EWM中调整PSA到存储位的分配，或在仓库任务确认过程中进行管理。

希望以上说明能为您提供所需的解答。

此致

敬礼

Chris

"AI enabled content Translation"

entry.title: Re: Migrative data for PO upload
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

 

Migrate your Data application allows to migrate the initial set of data that is required to start business operations. This data includes:

  • Master data such as customer master data, supplier master data, and so on.

  • Open transactional data. This includes open items, open sales and purchase orders, as well as other open transactions.

  • Balances such as material inventory balances, bank account balances, G/L account balances, and so on. You can also migrate historical account balances.

Open documents need to be processed in the source system before the migration. Freeze periods for changes or double maintenance might be required for some master data objects during the cutover period. For example, partially delivered sales orders must be closed in the source system. Partially open purchase orders must either be closed or cancelled in the source system.

But as per your question to migrate closed PO,

Historical data cannot be migrated. Historical data (transactional data that has been created in the past and relates to long-running or closed processes) cannot be migrated.

Please refer to the below help document for your reference,

What Data Can Be Migrated? | SAP Help Portal

 

Thanks and Regards,
SAP Support.

entry.title: Challenge with sensitive data in SAP SuccessFactors Story Reports
entry.content:
We're facing a challenge when trying to visualize gender distribution in SAP SuccessFactors Story Reports.

Since gender is classified as sensitive data, the system requires a context field, such as Person ID, to access it. However:

  • Without Person ID → no data is shown
  • With Person ID as a dimension → report becomes unreadable, as it lists all individual Person ID

Our goal is to display gender percentages in a clean bar chart (e.g. headcount by gender or gender distribution over time).

Has anyone found a clean workaround or best practice for this scenario, ideally without using a custom field that replicates gender?

Any insights or tips would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Help Needed with Accrual Rule for India – Probation Period Handling
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community, 

I need support with an accrual rule for India, where the probation period end date should be considered in the accrual logic.

Business scenario:

  • During the probation period, employees do not receive any Privilege Leave.

  • After the end of probation, employees are entitled to 1.25 days of Privilege Leave per month.

  • The confirmation of probation can occur on any day within the month.

Example:
An employee joins on 05.05.2024, and the probation period ends on 06.05.2025.
In this case, May 2025 should be included in the accrual calculation, since the confirmation occurs within the same month.

Current issue:

  • The current business rule excludes the probation confirmation month and begins accrual from the following month (e.g. from June in the above example).

  • After testing and some adjustments, we found that the rule only works correctly if the Job Information record starts on the 1st of the month or before the confirmation date.

    • In that case, the confirmation month is correctly included in the accrual calculation.

Question:

Is there any way to include the probation confirmation month in the accrual logic even if the confirmation date is not on the 1st of the month? Can this be achieved by configuring the business rule differently or by using a workaround?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you and best reagrds

Thiphawan

entry.title: Re: SAC Story Filters: Profit Center & Product – Dependen...
entry.content:
@vinay_009 

Data Access control only work on Fact data and not Master Data. So even with DAC, you would see all profit center in Story filter. They might not show up on table as fact data in table will be restricted to PC where the user has access to. With cascading option enabled on the story filter for products, it can restrict products filter with only those PC combination which has data which is anyway controlled by DAC for PC. After QRC3 upgrade the table in un booked state can be set to show only member combination respecting the DAC so it will show only valid PC but for products valid combination either set up validation rules or DAC.

 

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/b46f2f74aea04c399ccb5c9b1bcc225e.html#securing-data-at-the-dimension-level

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: How to delete Local ($TMP) objects from PRD.
entry.content: Hi , please note that according to our Rules of Engagement: "If you want to publish content that was helped/created by GenAI, you must add the user tag  GenAI Assisted Content. For content where it's not possible to add a user tag (e.g., answers), you must include this statement: "GenAI was used to help generate this content." We have edited your answer and added the GenAI-statement as we detected AI-generated content in your post. Thank you for your contribution in the SAP Community! Best regards, Kavya

entry.title: Limitations with historical Data in SAP SuccessFactors Story Reports?
entry.content:
We're trying to build Story Reports that compare historical headcount (e.g. 2022–2024) and visualize metrics like rolling turnover rates. However, we're struggling to generate clean historical views due to the lack of date-based fields.

While calculated fields (e.g. "Today minus 1 or 2 years") are possible, they don’t provide true point-in-time snapshots in order to create line chart showing headcount trends over time.

Are Story Reports simply not designed for this kind of historical analysis?
I’ve read that they work well for current snapshots, but are limited for historical comparisons, since the system isn’t a full data warehouse?

Thanks in advance for any insights!

In short I'm using Workzone as an intranet and workspaces as my subsections. This is necessary because of the limited number of navigation levels available (essentially three levels is the deepest you can go with the stock navigation). 

So I want search to search all my workspaces from anywhere in the whole tenant - I'll never be able to teach my users to reset the scope control to "All" from "This Workspace" every time.

entry.title: Re: Standard and Custom condition types - PO pricing cond...
entry.content:
Hello @KARTHIK-G ,

Thank you for your question,

In the PO UI, there is no clear visual indicator to differentiate a SAP-standard condition type from a copied one unless you used Y/Z.

This might be the correct fix is configuration.

Prefer Y/Z IDs for custom types (SAP) guidance. SAP Learning/Configuring Condition Types for Pricing Elements

In Set Pricing Condition Types-Purchasing , retain only the customised type you wish to use access sequence control, SAP Help Portal-Determining Tax Code in Purchase Documents using Pricing Conditions

In Set Calculation Schema - Purchasing, include that custom type in the schema and remove or exclude the standard one or set it to non-manual, so users cannot add it in the PO SAP Support Portal-3043325 - SSCUI - 101095 Set Calculation Schema - Purchasing and Statistical Flag Behaviour

SAP standard condition types have restrictions; if you need different behaviour, copy to a customer type (Y/Z). SAP explicitly advises this and even blocks certain changes on standard types  SAP Support Portal-2880754 - Cannot change Group Condition for condition type

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Apache Tomcat upgrade for SAP Analytics Cloud (9.0.44 to one the latest Apache Tomcat 9.0.x version)
entry.content:
Hello everyone

we are using SAP Analytics Cloud installed starting from SAC Kit Agent cloudagent 1.0.339 version.

It installed, as part of this software package, also Apache Tomcat version 9.0.44 and JVM 8 on the server.

Now, we received a security vulnerability threat report and the security team has suggested to upgrade at least to 9.0.98 Tomcat version on the server.

So we would like to install this Tomcat version (that is a minor Tomcat upgrade because it's inside the 9.0.x family), and we have seen using a compatibility matrix, that JVM 8 remains compatible, and so we would like to upgrade to 9.0.108 version.

My question is: when upgrading to 9.0.108 Tomcat version , will the installed version of SAC remain fully compatible with this new version of Tomcat?

If not, please kindly suggest how to proceed how to achieve compatibility between SAC and Tomcat

Thank you so much, any comment will be appreciate

entry.title: The Pragmatist’s Guide to AI: From Architectural Foundation to Real-World Value
entry.content:
Picture this: a demand forecast model trained on years of sales data looks perfect in testing, but once live, it misses a major promotion and a supply chain disruption because that data sits elsewhere. The model wasn’t wrong — it was perfectly wrong.

At SAP TechEd 2025, a joint session with Google Cloud will show how to close the Context Gap and unlock real business impact with AI. The session will explore:

  • The provocation – Casey West, Lead Developer Advocate at Google Cloud, reframes the AI challenge, introducing the Context Gap.
  • The proof in action – Laura Marwood, SAP Product Strategist for the SAP Business Suite will show a live demo on how SAP’s unified suite lets AI orchestrate seamlessly across roles and systems that turns chaos into growth
  • The architectural blueprint – Manoj Swaminathan, GM and CPO of the SAP Business Suite, Finance and Spend explains the foundation: a clean core, unified data fabric on BTP, and embedded AI by design.
  • The playbook – A practical maturity model guides teams from efficiency > productivity > true impact.

This is AI for pragmatists: closing the Context Gap with SAP’s suite-first strategy so AI doesn’t just generate output - it creates lasting business value.

👉 Don’t miss this session at SAP TechEd 2025!

https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog/session/1749125306565001Gf8a

entry.title: Physical IP missing for Load balancer (ASCS Host) on VPC servers
entry.content:
We install ASCS on application Load Balancer (ALB) which does not have physical IP assigned in VPC scenario. And due to limitation in clustering limitation, we can not assign physical IP to ALBs.

 

While doing SSI in FRUN for ASCS, ALB IP information is missing, which results SSI red and does not monitor ASCS. 

 

As workaround we use to add dummy IP in /etc/host file of ALB, which fix issue for monitoring but application does not restart and communication with application server fails. Finally system goes down. which is major impact on business. 

We need help from you to provide another way to get IP address not from /etc/ host file. Any parameter or any changes in FRUN LMDB host details or Agent parameter, which should not overwrite next LMDB sync. 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Physical IP missing for Load balancer (ASCS Host) on...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

SAP Focused Run monitoring relies on hostname resolution to valid IP addresses. This requirement does not align with an application Load Balancer based VPC setup, where no static IP is provided.

  • The /etc/hosts workaround can resolve the hostname for monitoring, but it will break real connectivity and cause ASCS/application failures.

  • There is no supported parameter in Focused Run LMDB or agent that allows a static IP override that persists after synchronization.

Therefore, this scenario is outside the support scope of SAP Focused Run.

We recommend that you engage your Virtual Private Cloud / Cloud Network support team to:

  1. Configure a DNS alias (e.g., via Route53, Azure DNS, or similar) that points to the application Load Balancer DNS name.

  2. Ensure this alias is maintained as the ASCS virtual hostname in LMDB.

  3. Explore Virtual Private Cloud-level options such as NAT, elastic IPs, or endpoint IP mappings if your cloud provider allows it.

These steps need to be handled at the cloud network layer, not within Focused Run.

entry.title: AI-assisted US Tax Jurisdiction Configuration
entry.content:
Setting up jurisdiction codes for the sales and use tax solution for the United States has long been a complex, time-consuming process, but that’s about to change!

We’re excited to introduce a new AI-assisted configuration feature designed to make it faster and easier than ever to set up your tax jurisdiction codes. If you’re using tax procedure TAXUSJ in  yourSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system, then this innovation is for you!

We’ll be the first to admit that the old way of configuration your US sales and use tax jurisdictions was cumbersome. It often involved more than 10 steps, required deep technical knowledge, and needed you to use formats that aren’t necessarily intuitive. This meant you had to reach out for support and to ask for a cleaner, more intuitive solution

This is where we brought AI in. With our new AI-assisted configuration tool, you can:

  • Maintain tax jurisdictions in a more intuitive way
  • Speed up onboarding for US-based businesses
  • Automatically detect and propose missing compliance configurations

To use this feature, you'll need to log in with a user configured as described in the Enabling AI-Assisted US Tax Jurisdiction Configuration topic. You can use natural language prompts in the Propose Configuration Information tool within the Upload Tax Rates (100426) configuration activity to obtain detailed address information that can be used to configure and check tax jurisdiction breakdowns.

While you’re there, check out our how-to video for a step-by-step walkthrough of the AI-assisted configuration tool.

Ready to try it out? Log in and explore the AI-assisted configuration today!

And if you have more pain points that we can address, don’t be shy! Reach out here in the comments or use the handy feedback feature on the SAP Help Portal to leave a comment that we can take up and look for more ways we can help you run simple.

entry.title: Re: Business Data Validation of Custom Reports using Data Transition Validation (DTV) tool
entry.content:
Hi @MJVS 

You cannot add any SAP standard report on your own to the DTV tool. SAP standard reports which are supported by DTV tool comes along with the pre-delivered content.

You can find the list of SAP reports that currently available in the pre-delivered content in the SAP Note:  3258383 - DTV : SAP Pre- delivered Content - SAP for Me

and also implement this Note in case the system does not have the latest pre-delivered content.

Thanks, and Regards

Abhya

entry.title: Re: SAP GROUP REPORTING INVESTMENT
entry.content:
Hi,

Are you using activity based consolidation of investements or rule based?

If you use activity based the SAP standard data monitor has a task for uploading additional information for investments. In this you can upload the change in investment along with the activity type. 10 - Partial divestiture seems appropriate for your scenario.

You can find information on SAP Help for posting examples and activity codes: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/4ebf1502064b406c964b0911adfb3f01/9f4f7fe3d80b4b47b32906c95a8b7adb.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST For rule based you can deduct the ownership percent on your stat account, properly S000001 or similar.

This you can do using the normal flexible upload. Just remember this YTD / periodic parameter - you don't want to add the percent with the old... tried that myself more than ones.

Br Martin Jul

entry.content:

I’m working on a workflow scenario in SAP Build Process Automation where purchase orders go through multiple approval levels (e.g., Approvers and Finance Reviewer).

The requirement is:

  • If an approver or finance reviewer does not take any action within N+2 days (2 days after task creation/assignment), the system should automatically trigger a reminder email.

  • Ideally, this should continue until action is taken, or the task is escalated.

entry.title: How do I add international freight and insurance costs to a material's price in SAP?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are having issues with processing international Purchase Orders (POs) in SAP. We need to create a single Purchase Requisition (PR) but use it to generate three separate POs: one for the materials, one for freight, and one for insurance. The primary challenge is ensuring the costs for freight and insurance are automatically added to the material's final price upon goods receipt. What is the correct configuration or process to handle this "landed cost" scenario while allowing for separate invoices from different vendors (material supplier, freight forwarder, and insurance company)

Best Regards,

Nithin Pranesh

entry.title: CPF Excess for New Starter in Previous Financial Year
entry.content:
Hi All,

I'm looking for some help to understand if the following is correct system behaviour with regards to CPF excesses on additional wages (AW).

Employee A was hired 01.12.2024 and had 1 month of payroll results. 

Employee continued through the payroll (monthly) for periods 1 to 8 receiving base salary in excess of the $7,400 OW cap. The system correctly calculates CPF of 20% (EE) and 17% (ER) each pay period on the maximum $7,400 ($1,480 and $1,258 respectively).

In pay period 9, the employee receives a bonus of $14,716 (AW). The system calculates CPF on the full $14,716 as the system is using the previous years OW to determine the cap for AW rather than the $13,200 expected. 

In pay period 12, CPF excess wage types are generated and the employee has a total excess contribution of $561. We now have to request a refund from the CPF board for the amount.

Is it correct that this excess is generated in this situation? And if so, is this just part and parcel of Singapore payroll year end processing? Does anyone have any tips on the best way to manage the refunds once they are returned from the CPF board? It is my understanding that infotype 3364 should only be used to refund the amounts when they are generated in error (i.e where there is an overpayment of OW/AW). There is no overpayment in the above scenario, simply calculating an excess due to limited pay results in the previous financial year.

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: How to update or maintain Multilingual Text for Equip...
entry.content:
Hello @AbhijitGoswami 

Manual maintenance is possible: Use the Create/Change Technical Object apps to update the description or long text while logged in for each target language; texts are language-dependent, and the APIs include a Language field for equipment/functional-location long texts. SAP Learning: Configuring and Creating Functional Locations

API route recommended for updates/mass

Equipment: use the API_EQUIPMENT entity for Equipment Long Text to create or update texts accordingly to the language. SAP Business Accelerator Hub

Functional Location: use API_FUNCTIONALLOCATION (operations include Create/Read/Update Functional Location Text). SAP Business Accelerator Hub

Migration Cockpit: correct—intended for initial load, not for changing existing master data; use the APIs for updates. pages.community.sap.com- SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit FAQ

Your approach is sound. For ongoing maintenance, use the released OData APIs; for ad-hoc edits, log in to the target language and edit via Create/Change Technical Object.

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Transferring Verifiable Credentials with the Eclipse Dataspace Decentralized Claims Protocol (DCP)
entry.content:
In the era of Self-sovereign Identity (SIS), verifiable credentials (VCs) are becoming a cornerstone. Organizations and individuals can now issue, request, and present attestations  without relying on a central authority, enabled by emerging standards and protocols such as the Decentral Claims Protocol (DCP). This blog post explores two core ways VCs are transferred from an issuer wallet tenant to a holder wallet tenant using Decentralized Identity Verification (DIV) focusing on automation options available to both issuers and holders.

 

Two VC Transfer Patterns

With DCP, there are two main patterns for moving a verifiable credential from the issuer's environment to the holder's:

Holder-Initiated Credential Request

Holder requests VCs:

  • The holder launches their VC request app and picks the issuer from which they wish to request credentials.
  • The app pulls published credential types (from the issuer's metadata endpoint), ensuring the holder can only request credentials the issuer offers. 

     
  • The users selects the credential types to be requested
  • Next, the holder selects which identity to use (think multiple DIDs or personas in their wallet).
  • A request for the selected credential type(s), tied to the chosen identity, is dispatched to the issuer.

 

API to Request VCs

This feature can also be consumed via API, enabling deep integration into other applications and seamless automation of decentralized credential workflows.

POST {srv}/api/v2.0.0/dcp/requestCredentials/{app_name}
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {token}
{
  "requestedCredentials": [
    {
      "credentialType": "BpnCredential",
      "format": "vcdm11_jwt"
    }
  ],
  "issuerDid": "{issuerDID}",
  "holderDid": "{holderDID}"
}

 

Issuer processes credential requests:

The issuer receives the request in their inbox. They review, approve, and send back the requested VC(s) to the holder. Alternatively, they may have to first create the credential before sending it.

Automation Option: Issuers can preconfigure their wallet to auto-respond to requests - if the VC is already ready. However, if credentials are not yet generated, or if the holder requests a set of credentials where not all are available, manual intervention is required.

Holder receives VCs:

Once complete, the holder receives the VC, visible in the credential overview section of their admin app. 


 

API to Respond to VC Requests

This feature can also be consumed via API, enabling deep integration into other applications and seamless automation of decentralized credential workflows.

Issuer Get Received Credential Requests

GET {srv}/api/v2.0.0/dcp/credentialRequestsReceived
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {token}

 

Response to VC Request -> Send Response to Request

POST {srv}/api/v2.0.0/dcp/credentialRequestsReceived/{requestId}/send
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {token}

 

Issuer-Initiated Credential Offer

Sometimes, the issuer wants to proactively notify holders that a credential is available or due for a refresh (e.g., before expiration or after key rotation). This issuing pattern is essential for refreshing credentials (e.g., after expiration or key revocation) because the issuer can push a new offer seamlessly, keeping the holder's status up to date with minimal friction.

Issuer sends offer

The issuer navigates their app to the relevant issued VC, opens the action menu, and sends a credential offer to the selected holder. The offer notifies the holder that a credential is prepped for them and can be retrieved.

Holder receives offer

The holder's wallet receives the offer. Here, behavior depends on their wallet's configuration:

  • Manual: The holder reviews the offer and chooses to make a credential request to receive it.
  • Automated: If the holder has marked the issuer as trusted with auto-accept enabled, the wallet will automatically convert the offer into a credential request and handle the entire transfer without manual clicks.

API to Offer VCs

This feature can also be consumed via API, enabling deep integration into other applications and seamless automation of decentralized credential workflows.

 

POST {div_wallet_srv}/api/v2.0.0/dcp/credentialOffers/send
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {token}
{
  "credentials": [
    "{vcId}"
  ]
}

 

Flexible Automation for Different Needs

A core strength of DIV is its support for both manual and automated flows. Depending on policy, user preference, and business process, any step on either issuer or holder side can be handled by a human or managed entirely by the wallet’s auto-configuration. In highly regulated or sensitive use-cases, both sides might want maximum manual review steps before issuing or accepting credentials. In high-scale, low-touch environments, the entire process can be embedded and fully automated.

 

Summary

Decentralized identity verification, enables seamless, secure transfer of verifiable credentials across wallet tenants. Whether initiated by holders seeking new credentials or by proactive issuers keeping credentials fresh, DCP allows maximum flexibility for both manual and automated workflows letting each participant tailor the process to their risk profile and user experience needs.

Read more

  • Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI): A Usage Catalyst for Dataspaces
  • SAP help: Requesting VCs, Offering VCs
  • API documentation in detail
  • Decentralized Claims Protocol

entry.title: Automate sending of loading instructions - Keep block BLL status of TU
entry.content:
Hi experts  , 

need your support to find a way to automatically create the Transportation Unit (TU) in EWM based on the Freight Order (FO) recently created from the VSR optimizer in TM.

I’m aware that the standard program "/SCMTMS/TOR_FO_PROC_BATCH" can trigger this process when the Load Plan Status is set to "Finalized", but this doesn’t align with our current requirement. In our case, EWM needs the TU to remain blocked until customs approval is received for the FU/FO. Only after that, setting the status to "Load Plan Finalized" should unblock the TU in EWM and allow the process to continue.

The challenge is that EWM currently doesn’t have visibility into which FOs are still under customs clearance. That’s why we rely on blocking the TU based on status to control the flow.

So the question is:
👉 Is there a PPF action or program that can send the loading instructions to EWM automatically without requiring the "Load Plan Finalized" status?

entry.title: In-House Kanban EWM without using planned or production orders
entry.content:
We are setting up a new production cell that would like to kit a complete tray of materials from a sub-assembly through kanban.

The idea is the kanban of the sub-assy is set to empty. 

A WT is created for each of the components in the BOM of the sub-assy

When confirmed the components are moved from the warehouse to the cell

Kanban is set it to full

The sub assy is confirmed via MFBF and components backflushed from the cell.

We don't want any planned or production orders being created, we just want it to replenish the material from the warehouse to the shopfloor. Is this even possible and if so could someone help outline what config etc is needed please?

entry.title: Re: CDS View for Monitor Purchase Order Items
entry.content:
Hello @AdamHorne 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at APIs in SAP Order and Delivery Scheduling, Purchase Order & Monitor Purchase Order Items for more details.

To summarise, the CDS view I_PurOrdScheduleLineAPI01 does not include delivered value and invoice value. These fields come from some other released CDS views.

I recommend enriching your custom CDS by joining them with I_PurchaseOrderDeliveryValuesAPI01 for delivered values. I_PurchaseOrderItemInvoiceValuesAPI01 for invoiced values.

Joining them will enable you replicate same figures you see in the app.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: FI-TV (Travel Management): S/4HANA and Enhancement Approach with PTK99
entry.content:
Hello folks,

I got a question regarding Migration Info in SAP Note 2719018 - S4TWL - SAP Travel Management in SAP S/4HANA Suite - SAP for Me .

In before: We are using FI-TV with heavily enhanced and partially modified database and business logic making usage of the Structure PTK99 which is reused in the PCL1-TE Cluster. We are solely using WebDynpro ABAP Apps for Enduser-Processes and SAPGUI Transactions which are not yet obsolete for power users. We do not use any Fiori Apps except for MTA (not MTR) rendered within the Fiori My Inbox.

My question concerns the following passage in the aforementioned note:

"(. . .)Table PTK99: The use of table PTK99 is not supported. Instead we provide an extensibility concept (please see SAP KBA 3296253 and 3260453). If you want to manage old data in the cluster corresponding to the structure PTK99, you will need to manage the mapping between the old structure (PTK99) and new structures yourself via extensibility concept.(. . .)"

This passage seems to be related only to the newly available Fiori Apps . However, at the same time, it does not explicitly state that the approach with PTK99 will still be supported for "the old stuff". Since the codeline is not changed aside from simplifications which (as far as I can tell) do not impede on this functionality, I'm 95% sure our approach should still be technically viable, but I would sleep better at night if somebody could confirm my thesis.

*Attempting to summon @FX-Vila *

Any replies are highly appreciated!

Cheers, Lukas

entry.title: Re: manager can create goals even if the goal plan is on...
entry.content:
Hi user116,

If the goal plan is locked but the manager can still add goals, it’s because of the permissions in the XML. You’ve probably given the manager access for that state, which is why they’re able to create goals even when it’s locked.

 

In the screenshot, the goal plan state is locked, but since I gave permission to the HR manager, they’re still able to create goals even in the locked state.

Check the PCR rules, If schema skips employees (due to grouping / country grouping mismatch), deduction won’t appear (PE03 )

run PC00_M**_CALC → Display Log for one correct employee and one missing case. Compare where /420 gets generated.

entry.title: My expert playlist, SAP TechEd, Berlin
entry.content:
PAR107 | SAP and Databricks: Real-time insights and AI without ETL 

Turn your trusted SAP data into AI-driven innovation - without the complexity of ETL. See how the SAP Business Data Cloud solution integrates with Databricks using Delta Sharing to provide more-secure, live access to SAP data for use with AI, data engineering, data warehousing, governance, and BI, and how global enterprises are accelerating value.

DA160 | SAP Business Data Cloud from set up to streamline: A practical walk-through 

Gain practical expertise in the SAP Business Data Cloud solution. Explore the solution’s core components, learn how to activate and manage them, and practice strategies to streamline data integration, governance, and access. Find out how to use SAP Business Data Cloud to simplify complex data processes and deliver scalable, trusted data solutions.

DA266 | Operationalizing AI with SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud 

The SAP Databricks capability, fully native in the SAP Business Data Cloud solution, brings scalable AI and ML to enterprise data. This session covers activating SAP Databricks, accessing and sharing governed data, building models, and running secure AI workflows—bridging data engineering and science without duplication.

DA203 | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse 

Explore best practices for modernizing your SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW) application with the SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) solution. Learn how to minimize migration risks, keep existing objects in SAP BW, and deliver the objects as managed data products and intelligent applications while using the latest data and AI capabilities in SAP BDC.

DA264 | SAP Business Data Cloud: Explore the analytical components end to end 

Take a hands-on journey through the analytical components of the SAP Business Data Cloud solution. Use the SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud solutions to design and build custom scenarios from beginning to end. This session is ideal for technical users seeking to transform data into meaningful business insights. 

DA205 | A deep dive into SAP as customer zero of SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) 

Discover SAP’s journey of adopting SAP BDC and its pivotal role in SAP’s data democratization strategy with Product 360 as an internal frontrunner. Get practical tips from the integration with Databricks and SAP Business Technology Platform as the foundation for adapting, enhancing, and automating key business processes with SAP Business AI.

Not registered yet? Register now: https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html

entry.title: Strategic Product Roadmap Update for Partners H2 2025 (APJ/EMEA)
entry.content:
PLEASE NOTE: Selecting the option "Register Now" button or "Yes" to "Will you be attending?" will NOT register you for the event. To register for the event, please REGISTER HERE in order to receive the event invite and login details. 

 

Session Information:
 
Dear Partners, join us to hear about the Solution Roadmap and broader view on the strategy and the direction that SAP SuccessFactors is taking for 2026 and beyond. These sessions are going to provide a high level overview of the strategy of the SAP SuccessFactors solution. There will not be in-depth or technical content of features and functionalities. To find those, please attend the webinar release sessions that can be found within the Product Release & Road Map Information page.
Please be informed that this session will be specifically focused on Partners, with the appropriate support. Customer sessions will be happening in the week following.
Please note the session will have available closed captions as well as ZOOM automatic close caption translation. (Available languages: Spanish, Portuguese, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Thai, German, French and many more!)


APJ & EMEA Session - Tuesday, 21st October 2025

15:00 SGT Singapore
9:00 CEST Europe

REGISTER HERE!

 

If you have any questions, please get in touch with the Program Manager: vanesa.dubournet@sap.com

entry.title: 🔵 Behind the Magic: How Cirque du Soleil Reimagined Invoice Management with SAP Business AI
entry.content:
Cirque du Soleil Entertainment Group is a global leader in live entertainment. With over 4,000 employees, approximately 1,200 of them artists from about 80 countries, their shows are known for artistry, theatrics, live music, and breathtaking performances.
Cirque du Soleil processes over 70,000 invoices per year from vendors all over the world. The Accounts Payable department was overwhelmed with invoice inquiries asking, “What is the status of my invoice?”
To address this, Cirque du Soleil turned to SAP Business AI. The new AI-powered Invoice Assistant automates the review and response process for invoice-related emails. Powered by SAP Business AI and built on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP), the solution is already delivering faster response times, enhanced supplier experiences, and seamless multilingual automation.
In this session you will learn how automation keeps the show running smoothly behind the curtain starting with the AI Discovery workshop used to identify and select the Invoice Assistant scenario to an application demo which helps you determine whether scenarios are embedded AI features or GenAI Hub custom AI use cases on SAP BTP. You will also explore that Invoice Assistant architecture and resources for building your own Invoice Assistant.
Join us to step behind the curtain to see how AI transformed invoice management into a well-choreographed act.
 
Speakers
  • Sally Lawler Kennedy, SAP
  • Carlos Estala, SAP
  • Kay Schmitteckert, SAP

entry.title: Re: Error: Missing Authorization (S_ADMI_FCD, PADM) When...
entry.content:
Hello @Manasa131,

more details would help to find the solution easier.

1) What SAP GRC Foundation version & SP are you running in central system? And what GRCPINW version is installed in connected system/s SPM activated?

2) Is SPM newly implemented or it was already done in the and working till now?

3) Has this auth issue appeared in the past? Or is quite new?

4) Has happened any update/patch/upgrade or any change in GRC or target SAP system, including role change/s, and then this auth error started to appear? Or just appears with no clear relations?

5) Have you tried to trace and check it in detail? And have you extended the role for FFID by missing auth objects? If yes, any progress seen?

In general, this is obvious missing auth situation so standard procedure should be used to solve it.

I've seen similar missing authorization reported by FFID Users but everytime as impact of previous changes.

BR, Olga
